result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert John Hanko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  Defendant is to re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel - TO BE DETERMINED.  Any money on file is to be applied first to the attorney fees and any balance to the fine and costs.  On April 18, 2016 the Court determines the attorney fees to be $301.00 - paid in full.  Balance of the money on file ($299.00) has been applied to the fine and costs.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
To be completed by the end of probation - February 2017.  Proof of completion is to be filed with the Clerk of Courts and DA's office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert John Hanko

defendant.name: Hanko, Robert John
defendant.address: 246 N Washington St Apt 204, Berlin, WI 54923

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to the defendant in regards to the completion of the community service

9:04 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty J. Steven Heil.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - will plea to count 1 with a fine, community service and DNA sample and repeater will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty Heil concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and strikes the repeater.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Heil.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$100 fine plus court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-100 hours of community service - to be completed by the end of probation, next February 2017.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant to repay the costs for court appointed counsel.  

Court orders any monies on file is to be applied to the attorney fees and anything left over is to be applied to the fine and costs.

Court adjourned at 9:11 a.m.
from defendant - requests extension to pay 01/15 payment of court appt'd atty fees

10:52 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Max Saylor present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Saylor - has met with the defendant, and provides the DA with Discovery Demand.  Court sets for Status Hearing on February 22, 2016 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:53 a.m.
to Atty Heil with a copy of the criminal complaint, minutes and bail/bond

to defendant - request for court appointed counsel has been approved.  Court appoints Atty J. Steven Heil to represent him.  Defendant is to pay $100 every 2 weeks commencing 12/04/2015 for court appointed attorney
and Order - approved, signed by the judge
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:13 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant, requests court appointed counsel.  Court questions defendant regarding income.  Court requests defendant to sign paperwork.  Court questions defendant regarding payments.  Statement by defendant, can afford $100 per week.  Court orders defendant to pay $100.00 every two weeks, commencing December 4, 2015.  Court will appoint counsel.  

Court adjourned at 10:16 a.m.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:39 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and requests the Court read it to him.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as a repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 30, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:42 a.m.
